attributes.action: Standardise the amount of hours classed in a full time working week.
attributes.additional_details: Upon attending an interview this can vary from 30 hours to 45+. The difference of 15 hours can make a large difference to someone’s life. I think it would be extremely useful to standardise the English working week to around 35 hours. Baring in mind most people travel up to 1 hour to work, thats still 7.5 hours each day at work and adding the travel time, people can still be out of the house for 9+ hours each day. If jobs require more than the standard then they must be advertised as full time+.
attributes.background: Anyone who is job seeking for a full time job will understand the frustration of having to guess how many hours each companies ‘full time working week’ concludes of.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for setting the length of a normal working week, this is a matter for individual employers and their employees.

Workers are protected from working more than 48 hours a week, and from starting work less than 11 hours after they finished work, but working hours that meet these rules are agreed between individual workers and employers.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to reduce the maximum number of hours a person can be asked to work, if that is something you would like to happen.
